data.author: Richard Johnson

changelog.release_notes: Fixed a problem in the appKeys information which caused the app to crash on Android systems (but not iPhone's, interestingly).

Increased max number of projects from 5 to 10.
Program will now skip over unused projects automatically, however will always show at least one unused project, to allow adding another one from the watch.
Added the source to Github (see Source URL).
(Previously created project information will be preserved if you invoke configuration and then save again.)
Fixed a minor bug which resulted in initial times always having an hour of "21".

Added support for Pebble Round.
Also added support for clearing stats for a project by simply holding down the middle button for a full second.

Simple time tracking program for up to five projects.  You can edit the project names and times using "Settings" on the phone.  It's ok to run a different application while a project is being tracked and it's ok to assign time to multiple projects at once.  (Resetting to zero is done on the phone so it can't be done accidentally.)

data.description: Simple time tracking program for up to five projects. You can edit the project names and times using "Settings" on the phone. It's ok to run a different application while a project is being tracked and it's ok to assign time to multiple projects at once. Resetting to zero can be done by holding down the middle button for 1 second.  The program also tracks the bluetooth connection and displays a bluetooth symbol (with a buzz) when signal status changes.

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed a problem in the appKeys information which caused the app to crash on Android systems (but not iPhone's, interestingly).

data.title: Tracker
